alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 17 at 3:26PM AKDT until May 19 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR UPPER TANANA VALLEY AND THE FORTYMILE COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * TIMING...From Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * WINDS...Southeast 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 21 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that weather conditions could lead to the potential for a Red Flag event in the near future. This watch will remain in effect until it is upgraded to a Red Flag Warning or that it is determined that the Red Flag event will not develop. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
